file_name: AudibleInc_20001113_10-Q_EX-10.32_2599586_EX-10.32_Co-Branding Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Investment Distribution Agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text:
Payments called for by this Section 5 which are not
received within five (5) business days after the date upon which payment is due
will bear interest at a rate equal to the lesser of one and one-half percent (1-
1/2%) per month or the maximum legal rate permitted under the controlling Laws.
Payment of such interest shall not cure or excuse any breach of any underlying
payment obligation.
perturbation.changed_text:
Payments called for by this Section 5 which are not
received within five (5) business days after the date upon which payment is due
will bear interest at a rate equal to the lesser of one and one-half percent (1-
1/2%) per month or the maximum legal rate permitted under the controlling Laws.
Payment of such interest shall not cure or excuse any breach of any underlying
payment obligation.

However, payments not received within fifteen (15) business days of the due date will not incur any interest charges.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment terms. The original text states that late payments accrue interest after 5 business days. The added sentence stipulates that payments made within 15 business days will not be charged interest, creating confusion about when interest charges apply and undermining the enforcement of the initial late payment penalty.

perturbation.original_text:
Company will pay ACSI any Royalties
payable pursuant to this Section 5.4  [Royalties] on an annual basis, in arrears, as follows:
within thirty (30) days after the end of each Year as to which any Royalties are
payable, Company will remit to ACSI the Royalties payable with respect to such
Year, together with a report specifying in reasonable detail: (a) the gross
revenue generated by the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section余 and (b) Company's
calculation of the  Royalties.
perturbation.changed_text:
Company will pay ACSI any Royalties
payable pursuant to this Section 5.4  [Royalties] on an annual basis, in arrears, as follows:
within thirty (30) days after the end of each Year as to which any Royalties are
payable, Company will remit to ACSI the Royalties payable with respect to such
Year, together with a report specifying in reasonable detail: (a) the gross
revenue generated by the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section余 and (b) Company's
calculation of the  Royalties.

Notwithstanding the above, if the royalty amount is less than $[***], the payment deadline is extended to ninety (90) days after the end of the year.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding the payment deadline for royalties. The original text states that royalties are due within 30 days after the end of each year. The added sentence extends the payment deadline to 90 days if the royalty amount is less than $[***]. This inconsistency introduces ambiguity and uncertainty about the enforceable payment deadline, depending on the royalty amount.

perturbation.original_text:
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the
Receiving Party will: (a) use such Confidential Information solely for the
purposes for which it has been disclosed余 and (b) disclose such Confidential
Information only to those of its and its Affiliates' employees, agents, and
consultants who have a need to know the same for the purpose of performing this
Agreement and who are informed of and agree to a duty of nondisclosure.
perturbation.changed_text:
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the
Receiving Party will: (a) use such Confidential Information solely for the
purposes for which it has been disclosed余 and (b) disclose such Confidential
Information only to those of its and its Affiliates' employees, agents, and
consultants who have a need to know the same for the purpose of performing this
Agreement and who are informed of and agree to a duty of nondisclosure.

However, the Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information to potential investors without obtaining prior consent from the Disclosing Party.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict regarding the nondisclosure of Confidential Information. The original text restricts disclosure to employees, agents, and consultants with a need to know and who agree to a duty of nondisclosure. The added sentence allows disclosure to potential investors without prior consent, contradicting the restrictive nature of the original clause and creating uncertainty about the extent of confidentiality obligations.
